node.title: UK ICU doctor reveals every critically-ill COVID patient in his hospital is unvaccinated
node.description: Dr David Hepburn says patients who have died were people who would expect to live another 30-plus years.
node.content: ["An intensive care doctor in the United Kingdom has revealed that every critically-ill patient being treated at his hospital is unvaccinated.", "Dr David Hepburn told the Daily Mail as of Tuesday the critical care unit had no vaccinated patients at Grange University Hospital in Cwmbran, South Wales.", "\"All the COVID patients on ITU [intensive therapy unit] are unvaccinated at present and we've had several deaths this week.\"", "Hepburn told the Daily Mail those who have died are people who would usually expect to live another 30-plus years.", "New data from across England shows less than nine percent of COVID patients in critical care have had booster shots, compared to over 60 percent in critical care who have not had a vaccine at all.", "England's over-18s who have received boosters make up the majority of the adult population, compared to just the fraction who are unvaccinated.", "Politicians are urging adults to book themselves in to get the booster shot as the country's best line of defence against the current Omicron wave.", "Dr Hepburn says while COVID cases on his unit have been low he isn't holding his breath.", "\"This might be because of good vaccination levels locally or we haven't hit the peak of Omicron as yet.\"", "But in other parts of the South Wales hospital, the same can't be said.", "\"Large numbers of COVID patients being admitted and staff shortages are significantly affecting our ability to do routine operations, outpatients, and diagnostics which will lead to delayed diagnosis and treatment as well as worsen outcomes.\"", "Dr Hepburn added getting vaccinated significantly reduces the risk of needing medical attention.", "\"Even if your risk is low of getting seriously unwell, vaccination makes a huge difference to those around you who are awaiting treatment for other conditions.\""]
